messages.message: I'm now also seeing persistent 504s during demos this morning
I also can't log into dogfood this morning? :redsiren:
It just bounces me back to the website
I’m not able to reproduce this on dogfood by logging out and logging back in :disappointed:
@Matt Weaver have you tried doing a hard refresh? (cmd + shift + r)
but not in the same browser where i am logged into instabase.com (http://instabase.com)
hard refresh doesn't seem to work
in the browser where you can’t login, can you open the browser tab -> go to “Application” -> select “Cookies” in the left sidebar -> take a screenshot? (example below)
I deleted all cookies and tried again, and then it worked, thanks!

thanks for the screenshot! this will be really helpful for debugging. It seems like there are 2 `session` cookies - one for instabase.com (http://instabase.com), and one for dogfood.instabase.com (http://dogfood.instabase.com). I’ll look into our cookie headers to make sure they don’t apply on subdomains (ex: instabase.com (http://instabase.com) cookie being applied for dogfood) cc @Jessica

btw I was able to reproduce by logging into both prod and dogfood - if you’re logged into both, you’ll always be redirected to the marketing website in dogfood (fix and explanation here (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/21116))
FYI - I am gonna mute this thread.  Please let me know if I can provide any additional info!  Thanks so much for looking into this.

I am getting image errors/ timout problems here during a demo right now as well: https://instabase.com/apps/flow/results/SA_team/demo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/Custom%20[…]n%20Mutual/AttendingPhysicianStatement/out/batch.ibflowresults (https://instabase.com/apps/flow/results/SA_team/demo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/Custom%20Demos/Northwestern%20Mutual/AttendingPhysicianStatement/out/batch.ibflowresults)
Just to update, we’re continuing looking at this; the 504 Matt and Daniel reported are from different services but the cause could be the same. I’ll update here more.
